original: rnam shes mtha' med pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas yin la /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' med pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas yin la /
translated: Infinite consciousness is infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas nyid ni rnam shes mtha' yas par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas nyid ni rnam shes mtha' yas par gyur pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha' la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ming yin la /

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsam gtan 'di la rnam shes mtha' yas par gyur pa de'i gnas yod pas na rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //

analyzed: 'di la yan lag tsam gyi lhag ma 'am cung zad lus pa med pas na cung zad med pa yin la /

analyzed: de'i dngos po ni cung zad med par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Its entity is the state of becoming nothingness.üîΩThis is the name for the sphere of infinite space, which is consciousness

analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i ming yin la /
translated: devoid of the sphere of infinite consciousness.üîΩAs before, this concentration is called the sphere of nothingness because

original: snga ma bzhin du bsam gtan 'di la ci yang med pa'i gnas yod pas na cung zad med pa'i skye @193a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsam gtan 'di la ci yang med pa'i gnas yod pas na cung zad med pa'i skye @193a * //
translated: it is the abode of nothingness.üîΩThe concentration associated with neitherüîΩperception nor nonperception is the concentration associated with neitherüîΩperception nor nonperception because it is devoid of gross perception and

original: mched do // 'du shes rags pa med pa'i phyir dang / phra mo yod pa'i phyir na 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni /üîΩ'du shes yod min med min no //
analyzed: mched do // 'du shes rags pa med pa'i phyir dang / phra mo yod pa'i phyir na 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan ni / 'du shes yod min med min no //
translated: because it has subtle perception.üîΩThis is the sphere of neitherüîΩperception nor nonperception.

original: de ni 'du shes yod min yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'du shes yod min yang yin la /
translated: It is neither perception nor nonperception.

original: de ni 'du shes med min yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes med min yang yin no //
translated: It is not nonperception.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched kyi rnam grangs su gyur pa'i skye mched yin gyi /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched kyi rnam grangs su gyur pa'i skye mched yin gyi /
translated: It is the sphere that is a synonym for the mental faculty and the phenomenaüîΩsphere.

original: de skye mched gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de skye mched gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not other bases.

original: des na yod min med min skye mched do //
analyzed: des na yod min med min skye mched do //
translated: Therefore, it is the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di dag thams cad du yang dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid 'thob kyi yan lag 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad du yang dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid 'thob kyi yan lag 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In all of these, one attains complete transcendence of the object, but not complete transcendence of the members.

original: dper na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa rnams zad par sa la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig la dmigs pa ma spangs pa rtog pa la sogs pa'i yan lag las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba de ltar 'di rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa rnams zad par sa la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig la dmigs pa ma spangs pa rtog pa la sogs pa'i yan lag las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba de ltar 'di rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, in the first absorption, etc., one attains complete transcendence of the object, which is a single object such as earth, but not complete transcendence of the members such as investigation, etc. But this is not so for these.

original: 'di rnams la ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma las 'das pas dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma las 'das pas dang po'o //
translated: In these, the first is so called because one completely transcends the sign of form.

original: nam mkha' las 'das pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las 'das pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is so called because one completely transcends space.

original: nam mkha' la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is so called because one completely transcends the consciousness that enters space.

original: nam mkha' la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dngos po med pa las 'das pa ni bzhi ba yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dngos po med pa las 'das pa ni bzhi ba yin te /
translated: The fourth is so called because one completely transcends the non-existence of the entity of the consciousness that enters space.

original: des na de ltar 'di dag thams cad du ni dmigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'di dag thams cad du ni dmigs pa las yang dag par 'das pa nyid 'thob po //
translated: Thus, in all these, one obtains the transcendence of the object.

original: yan lag las yang dag par 'da' ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag las yang dag par 'da' ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But one does not transcend the members.

original: btang snyom dang sems rtse gcig pa'i dbang gis ni 'di dag thams cad yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa yin no //üîΩji ltar sbom po dang phra ba dang shin tu phra ba dang ches phra ba'i dogs pa las btags pa'i ras yug chu zheng mnyam pa bzhi po rnams la tshad khyad par med kyang reg na bde ba dang srab pa'i ngo bo dang rin thang che ba nyid
analyzed: btang snyom dang sems rtse gcig pa'i dbang gis ni 'di dag thams cad yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa yin no // ji ltar sbom po dang phra ba dang shin tu phra ba dang ches phra ba'i dogs pa las btags pa'i ras yug chu zheng mnyam pa bzhi po rnams la tshad khyad par med kyang reg na bde ba dang srab pa'i ngo bo dang rin thang che ba nyid
translated: All of them have two members, because of equanimity and onepointedness of mind.üîΩJust as a piece of cloth is designated as coarse, fine, very fine, or extremely fine, and although there is no difference in size, it is more and more delicate,

original: rnams kyis snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma ches shin tu gya nom par gyur pa de bzhin du 'di rnams yang yan lag gi khyad par med kyang phra ba dang zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma las gzhan rnams kyi nom
analyzed: rnams kyis snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma ches shin tu gya nom par gyur pa de bzhin du 'di rnams yang yan lag gi khyad par med kyang phra ba dang zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma las gzhan rnams kyi nom
translated: and the later ones are more and more refined than the earlier ones, so too, although there is no difference in members, they are more and more refined in terms of subtlety and peacefulness.

original: pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa dang / ches shin tu gya nom pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa dang / ches shin tu gya nom pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: and very refined, and extremely refined.

original: rnam par thar pa'i bshad pa lhag ma ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par @193b ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i bshad pa lhag ma ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par @193b ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The remaining explanations of the liberations are as explained in the clear realization of all aspects.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are the four absorptions, the four formless absorptions, and the absorption of cessation.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten universal bases are as follows:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar bo ste zad par brgyad dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang / zad par nam mkha'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar bo ste zad par brgyad dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang / zad par nam mkha'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, white, the universal base of infinite space, and the universal base of infinite consciousness.

original: de la zad par sa ni rnal 'byor pa gang zhig goms pas dbang du gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang po'i ting nge 'dzin las langs nas snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni nye bar gnas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin zhing rtog pa rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de la zad par sa ni rnal 'byor pa gang zhig goms pas dbang du gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang po'i ting nge 'dzin las langs nas snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni nye bar gnas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin zhing rtog pa rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: The yogi who has mastered the first absorption through practice arises from that concentration and enters meditative attainment on the base of infinite space. This is the antidote to the obscurations to abiding and it is said that since it is coarse investigation,

original: / yan lag stobs chung ba yang yin no zhes bya bar de'i skyon mthong nas /
analyzed: / yan lag stobs chung ba yang yin no zhes bya bar de'i skyon mthong nas /
translated: its branches are weak.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la zhi ba nyid du yid la byas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la zhi ba nyid du yid la byas te /
translated: Seeing this fault, he focuses on the second absorption as peace.üîΩWithout fully apprehending the first absorption as a fault, he focuses on the branches of the second absorption as peace and obtains the second absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po la mtha' gcig tu yongs su ma bzung bar gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i don du yan lag rnams la rtog pa rtsam rags pa yin zhing dpyod pa la sogs pa la zhi ba nyid du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la mtha' gcig tu yongs su ma bzung bar gnyis pa thob par bya ba'i don du yan lag rnams la rtog pa rtsam rags pa yin zhing dpyod pa la sogs pa la zhi ba nyid du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The second absorption is peace because it is free of the fault of coarse investigation and analysis.

original: 'di rags pa'i yan lag spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang zhi ba'i yan lag thob par bya ba'i phyir de nyid rgyu mtshan du byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di rags pa'i yan lag spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang zhi ba'i yan lag thob par bya ba'i phyir de nyid rgyu mtshan du byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the earth kasi·πáa is the cause for abandoning the gross factors and obtaining the peaceful factors.

original: sa'o zhes yang dang yang du yid la byed pa ni zad par sar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa'o zhes yang dang yang du yid la byed pa ni zad par sar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúearth‚Äù is to be brought to mind again and again. It is to be established as the totality of earth.

original: de bzhin du zad par chu la sogs pa dgu po rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zad par chu la sogs pa dgu po rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin par blta'o //
translated: The same method should be regarded as applying to the other nine totalities, such as water, and so on.

original: sngar sgom pa goms par byas pa la ni chu klung dang / lteng ka dang / rdzing bu la sogs pa rnams su ma byas pa kho nar zad par chu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar sgom pa goms par byas pa la ni chu klung dang / lteng ka dang / rdzing bu la sogs pa rnams su ma byas pa kho nar zad par chu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For one who has previously practiced the meditation, the earth kasi·πáa will arise as a totality without any effort, even in relation to rivers, lakes, ponds, and so on.

original: de bzhin du nags kyi me 'bar zhing du ba 'thul ba rnams su ni zad par me'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nags kyi me 'bar zhing du ba 'thul ba rnams su ni zad par me'o //
translated: Similarly, in relation to a forest fire that is blazing and smoking, there is the totality of fire.

original: rlung gis bskyod pa'i 'od ma dang 'khri shing gi lo ma la sogs pa rnams la rlung 'di ni gnas 'di rab tu rgyu ba yin no zhes kun tu lta ba ni rlung ngo /üîΩme tog dang / nor bu dang / gos la sogs pa sngon po bting ba la ni zad par sngon po'o //
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod pa'i 'od ma dang 'khri shing gi lo ma la sogs pa rnams la rlung 'di ni gnas 'di rab tu rgyu ba yin no zhes kun tu lta ba ni rlung ngo / me tog dang / nor bu dang / gos la sogs pa sngon po bting ba la ni zad par sngon po'o //
translated: The all-encompassing blue is the perception of a blue cloth, a blue jewel, a blue flower, etc.

original: de dag nyid ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar por gyur pa la ni zad par ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar por gyur pa la ni zad par ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all-encompassing yellow, red, and white are the perception of a yellow, red, or white cloth, a yellow, red, or white jewel, a yellow, red, or white flower, etc.

original: tshon mo ste sa dang / @194a * //üîΩrlung dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams la ni zad par dkar po'o //
analyzed: tshon mo ste sa dang / @194a * //üîΩrlung dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams la ni zad par dkar po'o //
translated: The all-encompassing space is the perception of the sky.üîΩThe all-encompassing consciousness is the perception of the consciousness of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: skar khung gi nang la sogs par zhugs pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams kyi rtsig pa dang sa'i phyogs su bskyed pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang / shing gi lo ma'i tshogs kyi gseb nas byung ba rnams kho nas sa bzhi la bskyed pa zla ba'i 'od dang nyi ma'i 'od kyi thig le la rnam par lta ba ni zad par rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: skar khung gi nang la sogs par zhugs pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams kyi rtsig pa dang sa'i phyogs su bskyed pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang / shing gi lo ma'i tshogs kyi gseb nas byung ba rnams kho nas sa bzhi la bskyed pa zla ba'i 'od dang nyi ma'i 'od kyi thig le la rnam par lta ba ni zad par rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The light-circles generated in the wall and on the ground by the light of the sun and moon entering through the windows, etc., and those generated on the four sides of the ground by the light coming through the leaves of the trees, are seen as the circles of the light of the moon and the light of the sun.

original: skar khung gi nang dang / rtsig pa'i bu gal sogs pa rnams su zad par nam mkha' skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skar khung gi nang dang / rtsig pa'i bu gal sogs pa rnams su zad par nam mkha' skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of the totality of space arises in the windows, in the holes of the walls, etc.

original: gang zhig sngar bsgoms pa goms par ma byas pa las dang po pa'i sngom brtson la de ltar mi skye bas de'i yongs su sbyong ba'i khyad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar bsgoms pa goms par ma byas pa las dang po pa'i sngom brtson la de ltar mi skye bas de'i yongs su sbyong ba'i khyad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since this does not arise in the beginner who has not practiced the meditation previously, one should know the special training for that.

original: des ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi dbye ba dang bral ba'i chu dri ma med pa nam mkha' nas bab pa'am yongs su dag pa'i chu tshags las 'dzag pa rnams kyis lhung bzed dang khar gzhong la sogs pa'i snod gang yang rung ba bkang nas
analyzed: des ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi dbye ba dang bral ba'i chu dri ma med pa nam mkha' nas bab pa'am yongs su dag pa'i chu tshags las 'dzag pa rnams kyis lhung bzed dang khar gzhong la sogs pa'i snod gang yang rung ba bkang nas
translated: With that, one should fill any suitable vessel, such as a begging bowl or a basin, with pure water that is free from the distinctions of color such as blue and so forth, which has fallen from the sky or drips from a completely pure water sieve.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su 'dug cing bde bar gnas pas yid la byed pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su 'dug cing bde bar gnas pas yid la byed pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Then, sitting in a suitable place, one should begin mental contemplation while abiding in comfort.

original: 'di ni zad par chu'i yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par chu'i yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the total purification of water.

original: snum zhing snying po dang bcas pa'i shing dum bur gtubs nas shing drung ngam 'gron khang yang rung ste rjes su ma thun par rdza so gtong ba'i tshul du spungs te /
analyzed: snum zhing snying po dang bcas pa'i shing dum bur gtubs nas shing drung ngam 'gron khang yang rung ste rjes su ma thun par rdza so gtong ba'i tshul du spungs te /
translated: Having cut up oily, nutritious wood into pieces, one should pile it up in the manner of a kiln, either near a tree or in a guest house.

original: mtho gang sor bzhi'i tshad kyi bu ga byas pa kun tu sbar nas pags pa'am re lde gang yang rung ba'i stan mdun du bting ba la bde bar gnas pas 'og tu shing dang rtsva dang steng du bya 'phur bar yid la bya zhing dbus su me 'bar
analyzed: mtho gang sor bzhi'i tshad kyi bu ga byas pa kun tu sbar nas pags pa'am re lde gang yang rung ba'i stan mdun du bting ba la bde bar gnas pas 'og tu shing dang rtsva dang steng du bya 'phur bar yid la bya zhing dbus su me 'bar
translated: Having made a hole the size of a cubit or four finger-widths, he should sit comfortably on a seat of grass or straw spread out in front of the hole, and imagine that below him there is a tree and grass, and that above him there is a flying bird.

original: ba mthug po rgyu mtshan du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: ba mthug po rgyu mtshan du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: He should take as a sign the thick flame of fire in the middle.

original: 'di ni zad par me'i yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par me'i yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the total-purity training on fire.

original: med na byas kyang rung ste rtsig pa'i bu ga'am /
analyzed: med na byas kyang rung ste rtsig pa'i bu ga'am /
translated: If there is no fire, he may make one.üîΩHe should take as a sign the hole in a wall,

original: de'i skar khung gi bu ga'am /
analyzed: de'i skar khung gi bu ga'am /
translated: or the hole in a window,

original: nye kor du 'dug ste /
analyzed: nye kor du 'dug ste /
translated: or he should sit nearby,

original: yan lag gi phyogs gang la rlung gi reg pa der dran pa gtad par bya ste ;
analyzed: yan lag gi phyogs gang la rlung gi reg pa der dran pa gtad par bya ste ;
translated: and direct his attention to the part of his body where he feels the touch of the wind.

original: 'di ni zad par rlung gi yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par rlung gi yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the total-purity training on wind.

original: autpala sngon po dang gi ri kar ni la sogs pa yu ba dang / ge sar gsal ba dang / gos dang / snod dang / za ma tog sngon po la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba bkram pas kheng par byas pa'am /
analyzed: autpala sngon po dang gi ri kar ni la sogs pa yu ba dang / ge sar gsal ba dang / gos dang / snod dang / za ma tog sngon po la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba bkram pas kheng par byas pa'am /
translated: It is filled with blue lotuses, blue water lilies, and so on, with stems, pistils, and filaments, with blue garments, vessels, and boxes, and so on.

original: de bzhin du @194b ras sngon po rnga bo che'i mthil ltar brgyangs pa la ni la kang pa dang / pa la sha sngon po dang / mig sman sngon po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i tshon gyis 'pho ba dang / mi 'pho ba'i dkyil 'khor byas nas kha dog mi mthun pa gnag yang rung bas yongs su bcad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du @194b ras sngon po rnga bo che'i mthil ltar brgyangs pa la ni la kang pa dang / pa la sha sngon po dang / mig sman sngon po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i tshon gyis 'pho ba dang / mi 'pho ba'i dkyil 'khor byas nas kha dog mi mthun pa gnag yang rung bas yongs su bcad de /
translated: Or else, on a blue cloth stretched out like the surface of a drum, one draws with blue dye, indigo, collyrium, or whatever is available, the mandala with and without Mount Meru, and one encloses it with a fence of any color.

original: de dang nyi bar stan bde pa la 'dug nas yid la byed pa 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de dang nyi bar stan bde pa la 'dug nas yid la byed pa 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Then, sitting on a comfortable seat nearby, one should engage the attention.

original: 'di ni zad par sngon po yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par sngon po yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the cultivation of the totality of blue.

original: zad par ser po dang / dmar bo dang / dkar po rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: zad par ser po dang / dmar bo dang / dkar po rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The same method applies to the cultivation of the totality of yellow, red, and white.

original: 'dir sngon po gang yin pa de ni de rnams su ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog yin par bzung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //üîΩyang bum pa'i nang du mar me sbar ba kha bcad nas de la bug pa ha cang mi che ba gtod de /
analyzed: 'dir sngon po gang yin pa de ni de rnams su ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog yin par bzung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro // yang bum pa'i nang du mar me sbar ba kha bcad nas de la bug pa ha cang mi che ba gtod de /

original: bla ma rnams la bsu ba dang / skyel ba dag dang / chos nyan pa dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten la sogs pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog 'khor byin pas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bla ma rnams la bsu ba dang / skyel ba dag dang / chos nyan pa dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten la sogs pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang / g-yog 'khor byin pas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He has wheels on the palms of his hands and the soles of his feet because he has welcomed and escorted gurus, listened to their teachings, offered them flower garlands, gone to the temples and stupas with them, and given them servants.

original: de ni 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni 'khor shin tu mang ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will have a very large retinue.

original: yi dam la shin tu brtan pas na zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yi dam la shin tu brtan pas na zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
translated: He has very steady feet because he has been very firm in his commitments.

original: de ni gang gis rang gi rtogs pa'i chos la gzhan gyis g-yo bar mi nus pa mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni gang gis rang gi rtogs pa'i chos la gzhan gyis g-yo bar mi nus pa mi g-yo ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will be unshakable, in that no one will be able to move him from his own realization of the Dharma.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsten pas na phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsten pas na phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel pa ste /
translated: He has hands and feet with a netlike pattern because he has relied on the four means of gathering disciples.

original: de ni gang gis ma bsdus pa'i sems can rnams sdud par byed pa myur du sdud pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni gang gis ma bsdus pa'i sems can rnams sdud par byed pa myur du sdud pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an omen that he will quickly gather disciples, in that he gathers those sentient beings who have not been gathered.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bldag pa dang bca' ba bya nom pa rnams byin pas na phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba ste /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba dang / bldag pa dang bca' ba bya nom pa rnams byin pas na phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba ste /
translated: Because he gave excellent food and drink, chewable and suckable, he has soft and supple hands and feet, and seven elevated places.

original: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba gya nom pa 'thob pa'i snga ltas so //üîΩbcings pa thar bar bya ba'i phyir dang / srog bsrung ba'i phyir dang / srog gcod pa las slar ldog @202a * //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / bca' ba gya nom pa 'thob pa'i snga ltas so // bcings pa thar bar bya ba'i phyir dang / srog bsrung ba'i phyir dang / srog gcod pa las slar ldog @202a * //
translated: These two are omens of obtaining excellent food, drink, chewable and suckable things.

original: pa bsten pas na sor mo ring ba dang rting pa yangs pa dang sku che zhing drang ba ste /
analyzed: pa bsten pas na sor mo ring ba dang rting pa yangs pa dang sku che zhing drang ba ste /
translated: Because he freed those who were bound, protected life, and abstained from killing, he has long fingers and toes, broad heels, and a large and straight body.

original: de ni tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are omens of long life.

original: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs shing gzung ba yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dang / nyams par ma byas pa na zhabs kyi 'bar 'bur mi mngon pa nyid dang // sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs shing gzung ba yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dang / nyams par ma byas pa na zhabs kyi 'bar 'bur mi mngon pa nyid dang // sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa ste /
translated: Because he took up and upheld virtuous dharmas, increased them, and did not let them decline, he has inconspicuous ankle bones, and the body hair points upward.

original: de ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid dam gdul bya'i snga ltas te /
analyzed: de ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid dam gdul bya'i snga ltas te /
translated: This is the nature of not being completely subject to degeneration, or the sign of the disciple's former cause.

original: 'dir gdul bya ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams gang yin pa yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gdul bya ni yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams gang yin pa yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Here, the disciple is the realm of sentient beings who are completely gathered, and are ripe for being matured.

original: gus par byas te rigs dang bzo'i las rnams nye bar byin pa'i phyir dang / lhvam byin pas na byin pa ae ne ya'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: gus par byas te rigs dang bzo'i las rnams nye bar byin pa'i phyir dang / lhvam byin pas na byin pa ae ne ya'i lta bu ste /
translated: Because he gives respect and the arts and crafts to those who are near, and because he gives without being asked, he has the mark of the arms of one who gives, like Indra's.

original: de ni gang gis bshad par bya ba dang dgongs pa drangs zin pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni gang gis bshad par bya ba dang dgongs pa drangs zin pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is the sign of the disciple who quickly grasps what is to be explained and the meaning of the intention that has been brought up.

original: rang la bdog pa'i nor slangs na ster ba dang / med ces mi spyod pa'i phyir phyag ring zhing mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: rang la bdog pa'i nor slangs na ster ba dang / med ces mi spyod pa'i phyir phyag ring zhing mdzes pa ste /
translated: Because he gives his own wealth when asked, and because he does not say no, he has the mark of long, beautiful fingers.

original: phyag drang zhing ring ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag drang zhing ring ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of long fingers is straight fingers.

original: de la drang ba nyid ni bdog pa'i nor slangs pa mi sbed pa'i gya gyu med pa las yin la /
analyzed: de la drang ba nyid ni bdog pa'i nor slangs pa mi sbed pa'i gya gyu med pa las yin la /
translated: Here, straightness is due to the absence of the crookedness of not giving when asked for one's own wealth.

original: rang nyid ni slong mo pa ma spangs shing skabs phye ba las so //
analyzed: rang nyid ni slong mo pa ma spangs shing skabs phye ba las so //
translated: He is not without a begging bowl, since he is open to the occasion.

original: de ni dbang du gyur pa dang 'dul ba'i snga ltas te /
analyzed: de ni dbang du gyur pa dang 'dul ba'i snga ltas te /
translated: This is a sign of his mastery and his discipline.

original: sems dbang du gyur pas ser sna'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa 'dul bas thams cad kyi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dbang du gyur pas ser sna'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa 'dul bas thams cad kyi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since his mind is mastered, he is not under the sway of avarice, and since he disciplines the passions, he is never associated with adverse elements.

original: grogs po dang / rang gi skye bo dang 'brel pa dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams phan tshun mi 'byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can bye ba rnams bsdums pa'i phyir dang ; tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dang / gsang ba'i gros bsrungs pa'i phyir mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa ste /
analyzed: grogs po dang / rang gi skye bo dang 'brel pa dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams phan tshun mi 'byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can bye ba rnams bsdums pa'i phyir dang ; tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dang / gsang ba'i gros bsrungs pa'i phyir mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa ste /
translated: His sexual organ is enclosed in a sheath, since he does not separate friends, relatives, and kinsmen who are united, since he reconciles beings who are divided, since he takes up pure conduct, and since he guards the secret mantras.

original: de ni 'khor ba ji srid par sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir sras mang ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba ji srid par sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir sras mang ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a sign of his having many sons, since the lineage of the Buddhas is uninterrupted for as long as the world exists.

original: gding ba dang / dgab pa dang / gos dang ; khang bzangs dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gnas khang gya nom pa rnams byin pas na mdog gser 'dra ba dang pags pa 'jam pas te /
analyzed: gding ba dang / dgab pa dang / gos dang ; khang bzangs dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gnas khang gya nom pa rnams byin pas na mdog gser 'dra ba dang pags pa 'jam pas te /
translated: He has the color of gold and his skin is soft because he gave bedding, coverings, clothes, houses, palaces, and excellent dwellings.

original: de gnyis ni gding ba dang / dgab pa dang / gos dang / khang bzangs dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gnas khang gya nom pa rnams @202b rnyed pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gding ba dang / dgab pa dang / gos dang / khang bzangs dang / gzhal yas khang dang / gnas khang gya nom pa rnams @202b rnyed pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are the signs of his acquisition of bedding, coverings, clothes, houses, palaces, and excellent dwellings.

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pa'i phyir dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / ma dang ; pha dang / spun zla dang / sring mo rnams dang / bla ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su bkod pa'i phyir dang / de la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rim gro pa byin pas na ba spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pa'i phyir dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / ma dang ; pha dang / spun zla dang / sring mo rnams dang / bla ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su bkod pa'i phyir dang / de la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rim gro pa byin pas na ba spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
translated: He has hair that curls to the right and a face adorned with a tuft of hair between the eyebrows because he avoided crowds, and because he placed his teachers, preceptors, mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, and gurus in suitable positions, and because he gave them service and respect.

original: de ni do zla med pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni do zla med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is the sign of his being without an equal.

original: mu cor mi smra ba dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / legs par bshad pa la rjes su mthun par byed pas na ro stod seng ge lta bu dang / dpung mgo legs par zlum pa ste /
analyzed: mu cor mi smra ba dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / legs par bshad pa la rjes su mthun par byed pas na ro stod seng ge lta bu dang / dpung mgo legs par zlum pa ste /
translated: because he never spoke nonsense, never criticized others, always spoke pleasantly, and always agreed with those who spoke well.

original: de ni thogs pa med pa'i snga ltas te /
analyzed: de ni thogs pa med pa'i snga ltas te /
translated: These are signs of his unobstructed knowledge,

original: ye shes dang mthu thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dang mthu thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because his knowledge and power are unobstructed everywhere.üîΩHis arms are long,

original: nad pa rnams la sman dang rim gro pa dang sman pa dang phan pa'i zas byin pa dang rim gro byas pas na phrag pa'i bar rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: nad pa rnams la sman dang rim gro pa dang sman pa dang phan pa'i zas byin pa dang rim gro byas pas na phrag pa'i bar rgyas pa ste /
translated: because he gave medicine, service, doctors, and nourishing food to the sick, and served them.

original: 'di'i phrag pa gnyis kyi bar rnams shin tu rgyas pa'o //üîΩro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par smin pas thob pa nyid kyis ljags kyi dbang po 'di 'dra bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phrag pa gnyis kyi bar rnams shin tu rgyas pa'o //üîΩro bro ba mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par smin pas thob pa nyid kyis ljags kyi dbang po 'di 'dra bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: His tongue is long and slender,üîΩbecause he always spoke the truth, sweet words, words to be remembered, and words that were timely, reasonable, beneficial, and loving.

original: dbang po dang ro ngan pa phrad du zin kyang de ro bro ba mchog nyid du yang dag par myong bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang ro ngan pa phrad du zin kyang de ro bro ba mchog nyid du yang dag par myong bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: Even if he meets with inferior sense faculties and tastes, he makes them taste supreme.

original: de ni gnod pa nyung ba'i snga ltas so ;
analyzed: de ni gnod pa nyung ba'i snga ltas so ;
translated: This is a sign of his having little harm.

original: / kun dga' ra ba dang / 'dun sa dang / bsil khang dang / khron pa dang / bgrod dka' bar zam pa btags pa dang / kha zas dang / me tog phreng ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'dug gnas byed pa la sogs pa la thog mar 'gro zhing gzhan dag kyang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: / kun dga' ra ba dang / 'dun sa dang / bsil khang dang / khron pa dang / bgrod dka' bar zam pa btags pa dang / kha zas dang / me tog phreng ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / 'dug gnas byed pa la sogs pa la thog mar 'gro zhing gzhan dag kyang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: He goes first to make parks, assembly halls, rest houses, wells, bridges over difficult river crossings, food, flower garlands, temples, and dwellings, etc., and he encourages others to do the same.

original: snga ma rnams las lhag par byed pa'i phyir phyag gnyis brkyang ba'i zheng gi cha ji tsam yin pa 'og gi zhabs nas brtsams te spyi bo'i bar gyi khyon de srid yin pas na n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa
analyzed: snga ma rnams las lhag par byed pa'i phyir phyag gnyis brkyang ba'i zheng gi cha ji tsam yin pa 'og gi zhabs nas brtsams te spyi bo'i bar gyi khyon de srid yin pas na n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa
translated: Since the height of his body from the soles of his feet to the top of his head is the same as the width of his outstretched arms, he is like a nyagrodha tree, with a body that is as broad as it is tall.

original: ste / de ni mnga' brnyes pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: ste / de ni mnga' brnyes pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a sign of his having attained sovereignty.

original: yun ring po nas 'jam zhing snyan la mnyen pa'i tshig brjod pas na /üîΩstong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ji tsam bzhed pa'i bar du ljags kyis khebs par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / ngag gcig brjod pa rnam par rig pa du ma'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ljags ring ba dang / 'jig rten gyi @203a * //
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'jam zhing snyan la mnyen pa'i tshig brjod pas na / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ji tsam bzhed pa'i bar du ljags kyis khebs par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / ngag gcig brjod pa rnam par rig pa du ma'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ljags ring ba dang / 'jig rten gyi @203a * //
translated: Because he has spoken gentle, pleasant and soft words for a long time,üîΩhis tongue covers the great trichiliocosm as far as he wishes and is the basis for many different understandings of a single utterance.

original: khams mang pos bar du chod pa dang / gam la gnas pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po'i yul du mtshungs par gyur pa'i gsung dbyangs mnga' ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i dbyangs te /
analyzed: khams mang pos bar du chod pa dang / gam la gnas pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po'i yul du mtshungs par gyur pa'i gsung dbyangs mnga' ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i dbyangs te /
translated: His voice is like BrahmƒÅ‚Äôs because it is the same for those disciples who are close to him or separated by many world systems.

original: de rnams ni ngag gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung dbyangs thob pa'i snga ltas te /
analyzed: de rnams ni ngag gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung dbyangs thob pa'i snga ltas te /
translated: These are the signs of his obtaining the melodious voice endowed with five branches of speech.

original: ngag gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung dbyangs ni /
analyzed: ngag gi lam yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung dbyangs ni /
translated: The melodious voice endowed with five branches of speech is as follows.

original: kun shes par bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing rjes su sgrogs pa dang / mi tshugs shing rnar snyan pa dang / rig cing khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes par bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa dang / zab cing rjes su sgrogs pa dang / mi tshugs shing rnar snyan pa dang / rig cing khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: It is to be understood and cognized, to be listened to and not to be opposed, to be proclaimed and to be followed, to be unassailable and to be pleasing to the ear, and to be known and to pervade.

original: rig cing zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin te /üîΩde nyid kyis na khyab par byed pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rig cing zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin te / de nyid kyis na khyab par byed pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: To be known means to be realized.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo sna tshogs kyi rgyud rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo sna tshogs kyi rgyud rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to pervade because it pervades the mental continuum of the various disciples.

original: yun ring por tshig rkyal pa las log pa dang / dus su smra bas na 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: yun ring por tshig rkyal pa las log pa dang / dus su smra bas na 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba ste /
translated: The cheeks are like a lion‚Äôs because the Buddha has long since abandoned idle speech and speaks at the proper time.

original: de ni ngag btsun pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni ngag btsun pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a premonition of his pure speech.

original: rim gror byed pa dang / mi brnyas pa dag dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas na tshems shin tu dkar ba tshems mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: rim gror byed pa dang / mi brnyas pa dag dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas na tshems shin tu dkar ba tshems mnyam pa ste /
translated: The teeth are very white and even because the Buddha has served and respected others and has a pure livelihood.

original: de ni 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a premonition of his having gathered a retinue from the past.

original: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma med pa'i tshig kun tu spyad pas na tshems thags bzang ba dang bzhi bcu mnga' bas te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas bden zhing phra ma med pa'i tshig kun tu spyad pas na tshems thags bzang ba dang bzhi bcu mnga' bas te /
translated: Because he has long practiced words that are true and non-divisive, he has teeth with no gaps and forty teeth.

original: de ni 'khor mi phyed pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni 'khor mi phyed pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are omens of an undivided retinue.

original: 'khyud par byed pa dang smod par byed pa la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med cing rmongs pa med pa'i spyan gyis gzigs pas na spyan mthon mthing dang rdzi ma ba'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'khyud par byed pa dang smod par byed pa la yang chags pa dang sdang ba med cing rmongs pa med pa'i spyan gyis gzigs pas na spyan mthon mthing dang rdzi ma ba'i lta bu ste /
translated: Because he has eyes that see without attachment, aversion, or confusion, even with respect to those who embrace him and those who revile him, he has eyes like an ox‚Äôs.

original: de ni kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas te /
analyzed: de ni kun nas mdzes pa'i snga ltas te /
translated: These are omens of complete beauty.

original: spyan phye ba'i rang bzhin can dang chos mtshungs so //
analyzed: spyan phye ba'i rang bzhin can dang chos mtshungs so //
translated: They are similar to the nature of eyes that are open.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bshad zin to /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bshad zin to /
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great being have been explained.

original: // / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams brjod par bya ba yin te /

translated: His belly is not pendulous because he has destroyed the stain of pride. His navel is deep because he has realized the profound Dharma. His navel is coiled to the right because he has disciples who hold his teachings in accord.

translated: He teaches the Dharma that leads to a body as light as cotton wool, so he has hands soft like cotton wool.üîΩHe has attained the state of a great ascetic because he treats his own people and ordinary people equally, so he has fingers with prominent fingertips.

original: mchog tu zab cing brtan par gnas pas na phyag gi ri mo zab pa dang / rgya chen po la bzod pa'i chos ston par mdzad pas na phyag gi ri mo ring ba dang / shin tu rlabs po che ma yin pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pas na zhal ha cang mi ring ba dang /

translated: His tongue is red because he trains beings with the Dharma, which is difficult for the childish and the lustful to fathom. His voice has the sound of an elephant and the sound of thunder because he is not arrogant about the voice of an elephant or the sound of thunder.

translated: His voice is pleasant, gentle, and smooth because he has disciples who speak in a pleasant, gentle, and smooth way. His canine teeth are rounded because he has restrained the fetters of existence. His canine teeth are sharp because he is skilled in training sharp-witted people.

translated: His teeth are white because the supreme Dharma and Vinaya are pure. His teeth are even because he has entered the evenness of the levels. His teeth are fine because he teaches the realizations in sequence. His nose is prominent because he dwells on the high mountain of wisdom.

translated: His nose is clean because he is a pure being to be tamed. His eyes are wide because he possesses the supreme qualities of a buddha. original: mchog tu rgyas shing ring ba'i phyag mnga' bas na phyag rgyas shing ring ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bas na snyan mnyam pa dang / ma nyams pa'i sems can gyi rgyud 'dul bar mdzad pas na snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang /
analyzed: mchog tu rgyas shing ring ba'i phyag mnga' bas na phyag rgyas shing ring ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bas na snyan mnyam pa dang / ma nyams pa'i sems can gyi rgyud 'dul bar mdzad pas na snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang /
translated: His arms are long and expansive because he possesses arms that are long and expansive. His ears are even because he is victorious in the battle against the afflictions. His ears are unimpaired because he tames the mindstreams of unimpaired sentient beings.

original: blta bar bya ba thams cad rnam par spang pas na dpral ba legs par 'byes pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pas na dpral ba'i dbyes che ba dang / smon lam gyi mchog tu yongs su rdzogs pas na yan lag gi mchog shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba thams cad rnam par spang pas na dpral ba legs par 'byes pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pas na dpral ba'i dbyes che ba dang / smon lam gyi mchog tu yongs su rdzogs pas na yan lag gi mchog shin tu rgyas pa dang /
translated: His forehead is broad because he has completely abandoned all that should be seen. His forehead is very broad because he has completely defeated all the ascetics, brahmins, and adversaries.

analyzed: yul gyi bung ba'i dga' ba rnam par bzlog pas na dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dang / mthong ba dang sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal spangs pas na dbu skra stug pa dang / blo 'jam pos bstan pa'i snying po mngon par mkhyen pas na dbu skra @205a * //

translated: His hair is not disheveled because he is gentle and his mind is always undisturbed. His hair does not fall out because his speech is always gentle. His hair is fragrant with the sweet scent of the flowers of the branches of enlightenment because he always brings people together.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dper brjod pas de'i lan btab pa dang / sprul pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i lam sgom pa bzhin du dngos po med pa'i chos legs par rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu yin pas sgyu ma lta bu'i chos mthong ba byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu'i byed pa yin pa nyid dang /
translated: The reply is given by means of an analogy, the emanations of the Tathagata, the correct understanding of the fact that phenomena are insubstantial, like the meditation on the path by an emanation that is neither defiled nor purified, and the fact that the activity of a bodhisattva is the vision of illusionlike phenomena, since all phenomena are like emanations.

translated: The objection is raised that if this is so, it follows that it is pointless to engage in the welfare of sentient beings and that it is pointless for sentient beings themselves to engage in the path, since they do not understand it in that way.

original: de bzhin du phrin las 'og ma 'og ma rnams la yang brgal ba dang lan dang mtshams sbyar ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i brjod pa'i gnas skabs rgya cher ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
